River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to Polish director Djga Valladao’s style.
Looking into the idea of war against indigenous tribes even more closely we see why they were fighting to protect their land and families from being exiled. Hence there is no fanfare for what was accomplished or who did it.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely related to an unseen and ancient race: The half-African/Bantu and possible South African/African-American alien who kidnaps people to vivisect, hence the name, Knuckle Dragger.

I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie, like going to the theater or whatever.

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other aspects of their lives until they are engulfed in payback wrath by another group of stick-up victims. Alan Gordon makes his screen debut with voice for cut-up Jerry, a far cry from his later TV popularity.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you in and reminds me of your favorite Disney princesses as Pocahontas and Mulan. And voila, Brother Bear is good! If you’re looking for a serious animated movie, that has positive messages found in traditional folklore then this one’s right up your alley
